    • readCmdLineArgs

      public static CmdLineArgs readCmdLineArgs(String[] args)
      Processes the command line arguments and return an instance of the application settings, configured with the specified settings. To ask for help without running the application, the user must enter only the help flag (-h/--help), without any parameter or additional options.

      Show help/usage:

      • -h/--help
      Server args:
      • port: optional argument, the port number.
      • -a/--auto: automatic selection of the port number. If the port number has been passed as an argument, the server first try to open the connection on the specified port number. If it is not available, the server automatically iterate in order to find an available port in the range [1024,65535]
      • -r/--rmi: user RMI network communication.
      • -l/-limit maxLobbies: limit the maximum number of concurrent games on the server to the value maxLobbies (>=1)
      • -v/--verbosity lvl: set the verbosity of the server logging, to the value lvl, in range [1,4]
      Client args:
      • ip: the ip address of the server (required).
      • port: the port number (required).
      • -t/--tui: run in textual mode, instead of default graphical mode
      • -r/--rmi: user RMI network communication.
      Parameters:
      args - The array of string representing the command line arguments.
      Returns:
      The application startup settings.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If there are invalid format for options.

    • readSettings

      private static ApplicationSettings readSettings(String[] args)
      Processes the command line arguments and return an instance of the application settings, configured with the specified settings.
      Parameters:
      args - The array of string representing the command line arguments.
      Returns:
      The application settings.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If there are invalid format or options.

    • readServerSettings

      private static ApplicationSettings readServerSettings(List<String> options)
      Parameters:
      options - The options entered at the command line, after the initial params.
      Returns:
      The application startup settings.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If there are invalid format or options.

    • getOptionArgument

      private static String getOptionArgument(int optionIndex, List<String> options, Option option)
      If an option requires an argument, this method get the string next to the option flag in the args list.
      Parameters:
      optionIndex - The index of the args list.
      options - The list of all args.
      option - The option.
      Returns:
      The text of the argument for the specified option.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If there isn't any string after next to the specified option.

    • readClientSettings

      private static ApplicationSettings readClientSettings(List<String> params, List<String> options)
      Parameters:
      params - The arguments entered for the application.
      options - The options entered at the command line, after the initial params.
      Returns:
      The application startup settings.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If there are invalid format or options.

    • parsePortNumber

      private static int parsePortNumber(String portText)
      Parameters:
      portText - The text of the argument representing the port number.
      Returns:
      The value of the port number.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If teh value of the port number is outside the allowed range (from 1024 to 65035).

    • readParams

      private static List<String> readParams(String[] args)
      Processes the command line arguments and return the list of parameters. The parameters are the initial args that do not begin with "-" or "--".
      Parameters:
      args - The array of string representing the command line arguments.
      Returns:
      The list of parameters.

    • validateFlag

      private static boolean validateFlag(String flag, Mode mode)
      Check if the option flag is a valid flag for the application, depending on the running mode (Server or Client).
      Parameters:
      flag - The flag string, in the "-x" (short) or "--xyz" (long) format.
      mode - The running mode of the application.
      Returns:
      True if the flag is a valid flag, false otherwise.

    • validateServerFlag

      private static boolean validateServerFlag(String flag)

    • validateClientFlag

      private static boolean validateClientFlag(String flag)
      Check if the option flag is a valid flag for the client app.
      Parameters:
      flag - The flag string, in the "-x" (short) or "--xyz" (long) format.
      Returns:
      True if the flag is a valid flag, false otherwise.
